Discussion: ***A COLD WEATHER ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM EST THURSDAY UNTIL 11 AM EST FRIDAY *** Current Conditions at 3 p.m. EST Thursday afternoon: Fine particle pollution (PM2.5) levels remain in the moderate range across the area with temperatures having a hard time reaching the middle teens. Frigid conditions will continue into Saturday with moderate air quality prevailing. Here are the forecast details:  *** Friday’s forecast: After a very cold start, a partly sunny sky will warm the air some, but only to the lower and middle teens by late afternoon. Moderate levels of PM2.5 will be common, with the highest concentrations coming during the morning with very light winds in addition to a surface inversion setting up.  ***  Extended forecast: Moderate PM2.5 levels will start the day on Saturday with decreases during the afternoon. Continued rather cold with temperatures only reaching the middle teens. Good air quality is expected Sunday with partly sunny skies and highs in the upper teens. Temperatures will moderate early next week but remain below normal through the first week of February. Low pressure moving eastward out of the Midwest may bring snow to the area late Wednesday. Good air quality Monday, then deteriorations to moderate possible Tuesday and Wednesday.---McAuliffe
